about_the_game:
Prepare for a journey unlike any other with "Inu: Loas'Fate," a strategy game deeply rooted in the Haitian vaudou folklore and the mystique of the Bayou. Here, the boundaries of reality blur, and the powerful traditions of vaudou shape your adventure. Step into the role of Inu, a Loa of transformation, tasked with harnessing the powers of other Loas to defend Vilokan, your spiritual home.



Prepare to dive into the bayou, summon waves of mystical creatures, cast strategic spells, and march your forces through enemy defenses. Defeat the Potomitan on each archipelago to earn rewards and upgrade your deck. Every decision impacts your path to victory in this fast-paced, strategic experience.



  • Revolutionary Reverse Tower Defense: In "Inu: Loas'Fate," you don’t just defend, you attack. Create waves of mystical creatures and send them to overcome enemy towers in this genre-defining twist on tower defense.
  • Transformation: As Inu, you possess the unique ability to transform the creatures of other Loas. Mix and combine different ingredients to unlock new abilities and forge powerful new monsters.
                              
  • Deckbuilding: Customize your strategy by building a deck filled with powerful summons and magical spells. Each run brings new challenges, with a roguelite system that ensures no two journeys through the archipelagos are the same.
  • Immersive Vaudoo Setting: Explore a vibrant and rich vaudou-inspired world, interacting with legendary Loas such as Papa Legba and Marinette. Traverse the Bayou, where every choice has consequences.
  • Strategic and Tactical Gameplay: Plan each move carefully, manage your mana, and unleash devastating attacks. Upgrade your creatures and spells in the Great Cuisine to enhance your forces and ensure victory.
  • Procedural Archipelagos: Every trial takes place on a unique set of islands, reminiscent of games like Slay the Spire. Face different archipelago types, including boss battles, merchants, and specific challenges, all shaped by semi-procedural generation.
